Metadata: Vidalols A and B, new anti-​inflammatory bromophenols from the Caribbean marine red alga "Vidalia obtusaloba"

Chemical studies of the Caribbean red alga "Vidalia obtusaloba" have resulted in the isolation of two new bromophenolic metabolites, vidalols A and B. The new compounds were discovered as part of an organized effort to isolate new naturally-​occurring antiinflammator​y agents with a focus upon those which may function through the inhibition of phospholipase A2.
